intro: Cinchona condaminea var. candollii, commonly known as the Candollii quinine tree, is a species native to the highlands of the Western Ghats in India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and ornamental flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal value, particularly for containing quinine, which has been historically used in the treatment of malaria. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Due to its ecological and pharmacological significance, it is also a subject of conservation interest.
